column4: if I download the feisty CD image, is there a way to install that without burning it onto a CD? My laptop does not have a CD-ROM or floppy drive.
You can also use a USB drive if your comp will boot from USB
what if I
what if I am already running Ubuntu 6.10 and want to install feisty over it?
Why not just upgrade?
I tried and the upgrade failed
Failed in what way?
Failed in what way?

I forget the original error, but when I try to open the Update Manager it says the Software index is broken. Trying to fix that in the synaptic package manager says libsasl2 is broken, but when I try to fix it I get an error.
Try running: sudo apt-get -f install
yeah that gives an error too
Can you pastebin the error?
sorry I'm pretty new to this. Pastebin? You mean just paste it here?
okay, let me give you the error from synaptic package manager first, that one is pretty short.
E: /var/cache/apt/archives/libldap2_2.1.30-13.3_i386.deb: short read in buffer_copy (backend dpkg-deb during `./usr/lib/libldap_r.so.2.0.130')
okay pastebin url: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28188/
did that url come through okay?
Yes
What happens when you run: sudo apt-get remove --reinstall libldap2
see line 30 http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28189/
any further ideas?
